34 #include <boost/date_time.hpp>
35 #include <ros/ros.h>
36 #include <trac_ik/trac_ik.hpp>
37 #include <kdl/chainiksolverpos_nr_jl.hpp>
38 
39 double fRand(double min, double max)
40 {
41  double f = (double)rand() / RAND_MAX;
42  return min + f * (max - min);
43 }
44 
45 
46 void test(ros::NodeHandle& nh, double num_samples, std::string chain_start, std::string chain_end, double timeout, std::string urdf_param)
47 {
48 
49  double eps = 1e-5;
50 
51  // This constructor parses the URDF loaded in rosparm urdf_param into the
52  // needed KDL structures. We then pull these out to compare against the KDL
53  // IK solver.
54  TRAC_IK::TRAC_IK tracik_solver(chain_start, chain_end, urdf_param, timeout, eps);
55 
56  KDL::Chain chain;
57  KDL::JntArray ll, ul; //lower joint limits, upper joint limits
58 
59  bool valid = tracik_solver.getKDLChain(chain);
60 
61  if (!valid) {
62  ROS_ERROR("There was no valid KDL chain found");
63  return;
64  }
65 
66  valid = tracik_solver.getKDLLimits(ll,ul);
67 
68  if (!valid) {
69  ROS_ERROR("There were no valid KDL joint limits found");
70  return;
71  }
72 
73  assert(chain.getNrOfJoints() == ll.data.size());
74  assert(chain.getNrOfJoints() == ul.data.size());
75 
76  ROS_INFO ("Using %d joints",chain.getNrOfJoints());
77 
78 
79  // Set up KDL IK
80  KDL::ChainFkSolverPos_recursive fk_solver(chain); // Forward kin. solver
81  KDL::ChainIkSolverVel_pinv vik_solver(chain); // PseudoInverse vel solver
82  KDL::ChainIkSolverPos_NR_JL kdl_solver(chain,ll,ul,fk_solver, vik_solver, 1, eps); // Joint Limit Solver
83  // 1 iteration per solve (will wrap in timed loop to compare with TRAC-IK)
84 
85 
86  // Create Nominal chain configuration midway between all joint limits
87  KDL::JntArray nominal(chain.getNrOfJoints());
88 
89  for (uint j=0; j<nominal.data.size(); j++) {
90  nominal(j) = (ll(j)+ul(j))/2.0;
91  }
92 
93  // Create desired number of valid, random joint configurations
94  std::vector<KDL::JntArray> JointList;
95  KDL::JntArray q(chain.getNrOfJoints());
96 
97  for (uint i=0; i < num_samples; i++) {
98  for (uint j=0; j<ll.data.size(); j++) {
99  q(j)=fRand(ll(j), ul(j));
100  }
101  JointList.push_back(q);
102  }
103 
104 
105  boost::posix_time::ptime start_time;
106  boost::posix_time::time_duration diff;
107 
108  KDL::JntArray result;
109  KDL::Frame end_effector_pose;
110  int rc;
111 
112  double total_time=0;
113  uint success=0;
114 
115  ROS_INFO_STREAM("*** Testing KDL with "<<num_samples<<" random samples");
116 
117  for (uint i=0; i < num_samples; i++) {
118  fk_solver.JntToCart(JointList[i],end_effector_pose);
119  double elapsed = 0;
120  result=nominal; // start with nominal
121  start_time = boost::posix_time::microsec_clock::local_time();
122  do {
123  q=result; // when iterating start with last solution
124  rc=kdl_solver.CartToJnt(q,end_effector_pose,result);
125  diff = boost::posix_time::microsec_clock::local_time() - start_time;
126  elapsed = diff.total_nanoseconds() / 1e9;
127  } while (rc < 0 && elapsed < timeout);
128  total_time+=elapsed;
129  if (rc>=0)
130  success++;
131 
132  if (int((double)i/num_samples*100)%1 == 0)
133  ROS_INFO_STREAM_THROTTLE(1,int((i)/num_samples*100)<<"\% done");
134  }
135 
136  ROS_INFO_STREAM("KDL found "<<success<<" solutions ("<<100.0*success/num_samples<<"\%) with an average of "<<total_time/num_samples<<" secs per sample");
137 
138 
139  total_time=0;
140  success=0;
141 
142  ROS_INFO_STREAM("*** Testing TRAC-IK with "<<num_samples<<" random samples");
143 
144  for (uint i=0; i < num_samples; i++) {
145  fk_solver.JntToCart(JointList[i],end_effector_pose);
146  double elapsed = 0;
147  start_time = boost::posix_time::microsec_clock::local_time();
148  rc=tracik_solver.CartToJnt(nominal,end_effector_pose,result);
149  diff = boost::posix_time::microsec_clock::local_time() - start_time;
150  elapsed = diff.total_nanoseconds() / 1e9;
151  total_time+=elapsed;
152  if (rc>=0)
153  success++;
154 
155  if (int((double)i/num_samples*100)%10 == 0)
156  ROS_INFO_STREAM_THROTTLE(1,int((i)/num_samples*100)<<"\% done");
157  }
158 
159  ROS_INFO_STREAM("TRAC-IK found "<<success<<" solutions ("<<100.0*success/num_samples<<"\%) with an average of "<<total_time/num_samples<<" secs per sample");
160 
161 
162 
163 }
164 
165 
166 
167 int main(int argc, char** argv)
168 {
169  srand(1);
170  ros::init(argc, argv, "ik_tests");
171  ros::NodeHandle nh("~");
172 
173  int num_samples;
174  std::string chain_start, chain_end, urdf_param;
175  double timeout;
176 
177  nh.param("num_samples", num_samples, 1000);
178  nh.param("chain_start", chain_start, std::string("j2s7s300_link_base"));
179  nh.param("chain_end", chain_end, std::string("j2s7s300_end_effector"));
180 
181  if (chain_start=="" || chain_end=="") {
182  ROS_FATAL("Missing chain info in launch file");
183  exit (-1);
184  }
185 
186  nh.param("timeout", timeout, 0.005);
187  nh.param("urdf_param", urdf_param, std::string("/robot_description"));
188 
189  if (num_samples < 1)
190  num_samples = 1;
191 
192  test(nh, num_samples, chain_start, chain_end, timeout, urdf_param);
193 
194  // Useful when you make a script that loops over multiple launch files that test different robot chains
195  // std::vector<char *> commandVector;
196  // commandVector.push_back((char*)"killall");
197  // commandVector.push_back((char*)"-9");
198  // commandVector.push_back((char*)"roslaunch");
199  // commandVector.push_back(NULL);
200 
201  // char **command = &commandVector[0];
202  // execvp(command[0],command);
203 
204  return 0;
205 }
